q: What is motion along a straight line called?
a: **Rectilinear Motion** - Motion along a straight line (e.g., a car on a straight road)

q: What type of motion is the Earth around the Sun?
a: **Circular Motion** - The Earth revolves around the Sun in a nearly circular path

q: Define motion that repeats after a fixed time interval.
a: **Periodic or Oscillatory Motion** - Motion that repeats itself after regular intervals (e.g., pendulum, swing)

q: What is the SI unit of speed?
a: **Meters per second (m/s)** - The standard unit for measuring speed in the International System of Units
A speedometer measures the **instantaneous speed** of a vehicle at any given moment
**Uniform motion** is when an object covers equal distances in equal intervals of time, regardless of how small the time intervals are
**Non-uniform motion** is when an object covers unequal distances in equal intervals of time

q: How do you calculate average speed?
a:
Average Speed = **Total Distance / Total Time**

Formula: v_avg = d/t
